title: Mystery of Sherlock's secret sibling finally revealed in gripping and VERY confusing episode: 'Not impressed!'
text:

Sherlock came to a dramatic end tonight but some fans weren't happy. 
The mystery surrounding the detective - played by Benedict Cumberbatch - and his secret sibling was finally revealed. 
It turns out that in addition to having a long lost sister, he also had a childhood best friend he didn't know about called Victor. 
However, his sister Eurus killed his pal in a jealous rage by drowning in a well. Sherlock came to a dramatic end tonight but some fans weren't happy (Photo: BBC) 
For years, Sherlock often thought the family dog Red Beard was his best friend. 
But in gripping scenes, Eurus revealed that they never had a pet growing up. 
In fact, his fond memories of Red Beard were actually those of his friend Victor, but Sherlock had tried to suppress the painful memory of his death by changing his friend's identity in his mind. 
After the final installment of the series aired - titled The Final Problem, viewers were quick to take to Twitter admitting they were confused by what they'd seen. 
One wrote: "Did different people write Sherlock this year or did they just lose their minds and their sense of mystery? #whatthehell don't like the sis." 
Another then posted: "#Sherlock #bbc it's not clever TV just to make it so confusing it means nothing makes sense nor can be followed Not impressed." The mystery surrounding the detective - played by Benedict Cumberbatch - and his secret sibling was finally revealed (Photo: BBC) 
Moments later, a different viewer tweeted: "Not sure about this latest series of #Sherlock I have no idea what's going on! What happened to solving crimes?? #Confused." 
Shortly afterwards, another wrote: "Sherlock Really disappointed that this is the final episode. Last weeks was much better." Some fans were left confused by the episode (Photo: BBC) 
However, series creator Mark Gatiss has not welcomed the reaction from baffled fans. Read More Sherlock producers furious as final episode illegally leaked online ahead of BBC airing 
Lashing out at the criticism, he has told confused viewers to "go read a children's book" if they find his show too challenging to watch. 
Speaking to the Daily Star, he said: "People ask if it's good to challenge the audience. Of course it f***ing is. Why would you not want to challenge your audience? 
"I did a phone-in after the Christmas special a few years ago and someone said [Sherlock] was too complicated for people to follow. I said, "Oh, go and pour some warm paste into your mouth'." Sherlock is over for another series (Photo: BBC) 
He added: "Go and read a children's book with hard pages if you don't want to be challenged. We're making the show we want to make. We don't make it a certain way because fans are pressuring us." 
As promised by series co-creator Steven Moffat, this season's third episode concluded with a “grand old finale” type of ending. 
Now, some fans are worried this could be the last ever series. This may be the last episode of Sherlock ever (Photo: BBC) 
Whilst Moffat and co-creator Mark Gatiss have their own other writing commitments, the drama’s two main stars are amongst the most in-demand British actors. 
Both Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman are now huge stars Stateside meaning they have dozens of work offers and have had to fit Sherlock in around other film and TV work.
